name: The Way We All Go
description: Itâ€™s been two years since Atcchan, our protagonist, left his hometown; a small, sleepy village with a tiny population. Now he is finally able to return - but only for three days. How will his old friends react to him, and will their relationships be able to stand the test of time?
minimum_requirements: OS: Win XP+ Processor: 1Ghz Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: DirectX or OpenGL compatible card DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 400 MB available space Sound Card: Integrated

reviews.review_text: My first run through went pretty well, I didn't understand all this 'dark' stuff people were talking about. Then, after more runs, I understood what they meant. This is a great story, but it can be ambiguous. I really like the role of the kid, and the choices you get to make.  Now for criticism of the plot. Yes, this story is dark, and sometimes disturbing. It is written well to stab you right in the feelers.  If you are sensitive I reccomend you DO NOT buy this game, due to the gore/disturbing things that can (will) happen. However, for someone like me, I can tolerate the darkness just fine, and I don't get too upset/emotional over stuff. But this game hit me pretty hard too, so if you are new or a casual VN reader it might be a bit much. Overall I think the writing is very creative and intellegent, the music fits well, and the art is good. It is a good read if you want to release/feel some emotions.

This is an extraordinary game, generous in its many endings and paths. Some made me gasp in disbelief and some made me laugh. The endings and varied paths are marked by tonal and genre shifts. The writing is quite good, especially the dialogue. It really is a well-constructed VN.
Consumed my life for way too long. Just buy it.

I got this game thinking this will be a decent yandere game from the reviews and everything but NO! IT WAS NOT! It is pointlessly long, so far I have gotten through 4-5 endings and all I can think of is how annoying and wimpy the main character is. I do not want to read 12 pages worth of text about how out of shape you are from living in the city now that you are visiting the countryside where transportation is not as easy every 5 minutes. Sure there were funny parts like the main character's grandpa loves wearing Hawaiian shirts under his hama and other things I will not spoil, but the main character got on my nerves that I cannot continue reading.This reminds me too much of the anime School Days, I thought this would be more like Mira Nikki or Higurashi.  So if you want to get this game, please know the main character is annoying and wimpy.

There's plenty of endings and decisiones. I've only played one and I found it emotionally exhausting. There's a wide variety of feelings to be had, and they are all expressed within a few characters and within a short time. This compressed format makes it a very fast and concentrated ride. Definitely recommend, despite the ' quaility ' character designs. Don't let that turn you away from this VN, which is at it's best, intense.

Really enjoy playing the game. The story is indeed interesting depending on what route you take. It's too bad you can only have romance routes with only the two main girls in the game and not with the princess. I wish there would be someone who can make a guide to how to get all the endings to the game without spoiling anything. It is hard for me to figure it out and eventually I would love to get the best/special ending.

An somewhat short visual novel, with many branching paths that examine how friends can drift apart and reconnect, and how in trying to 'spare someone's feelings' we can actually make things worse. With 21 different endings ranging from happy to tragic, it has a lot of replay value.
